title: Methods and Systems for Door-Enabled Loading and Release of Payloads in an Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV)

events.title: Application filed by Wing Aviation LLC
Assigned to X DEVELOPMENT LLC
description: ASSIGNMENT OF ASSIGNORS INTEREST (SEE DOCUMENT FOR DETAILS).

events.title: Assigned to WING AVIATION LLC
description: ASSIGNMENT OF ASSIGNORS INTEREST (SEE DOCUMENT FOR DETAILS).

classifications.description: Stowage arrangements for the devices in aircraft
Aircraft not otherwise provided for characterised by special use of the remote controlled vehicle type, i.e. RPV
Flying platforms with four distinct rotor axes, e.g. quadcopters
UAVs specially adapted for particular uses or applications for transporting passengers; for transporting goods other than weapons for parcel delivery or retrieval
UAVs characterised by their flight controls autonomous, i.e. by navigating independently from ground or air stations, e.g. by using inertial navigation systems [INS]

abstract: Example implementations may relate to door-enabled loading and release of payloads in an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV), which could be a type of UAV in a group of UAVs that is assigned to carry out certain transport tasks. In particular, the UAV may include a fuselage having a first side and a second side, as well as a chamber formed within the fuselage and arranged to house a payload. A first door may be arranged on the first side of the fuselage, such that an opening of the first door enables loading of the payload into the chamber. And a second door may be arranged on the second side of the fuselage, such that an opening of the second door enables release of the payload from the chamber. Moreover, the UAV may include a control system configured to control flight of the UAV, and possibly opening and/or closing of door(s).
claims:
1. An unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) comprising:
a control system configured to control flight of the UAV; a fuselage having a first side, a second side, and a chamber arranged to house a payload; a first door arranged on the first side of the fuselage, wherein an opening of the first door enables loading of the payload into the chamber; and a second door arranged on the second side of the fuselage, wherein an opening of the second door enables release of the payload from the chamber.

2. The UAV of claim 1, wherein the second side is a bottom side that is substantially oriented towards the ground during flight of the UAV, and wherein the first side is a top side that is substantially opposite the bottom side.

3. The UAV of claim 1, wherein the first side is a bottom side that is substantially oriented towards the ground during flight of the UAV, and wherein the second side is a top side that is substantially opposite the bottom side.

4. The UAV of claim 1, wherein the control system is further configured to:
determine that the UAV is at a pickup location for pickup of the payload; and in response to determining that the UAV is at a pickup location for pickup of the payload, cause the opening of the first door to enable loading of the payload into the chamber.

5. The UAV of claim 1, wherein the control system is further configured to:
determine that the UAV is at a delivery location for delivery of the payload; and in response to determining that the UAV is at a delivery location for delivery of the payload, cause the opening of the second door to enable release of the payload from the chamber.

6. The UAV of claim 1, further comprising:
a propulsion unit including one or more unexposed propellers.
7. The UAV of claim 1, wherein the UAV is a lightweight UAV having a weight that is below a threshold weight.

8. The UAV of claim 1, further comprising an authentication system, wherein the control system is further configured to:
while the UAV is at a pickup location for pickup of the payload, receive, from the authentication system, authentication data indicating that a user is an authorized user; and in response to receiving authentication data indicating that a user is an authorized user, cause the opening of the first door to enable loading of the payload into the chamber.

9. The UAV of claim 1, further comprising an authentication system, wherein the control system is further configured to:
while the UAV is at a delivery location for delivery of the payload, receive, from the authentication system, authentication data indicating that a user is an authorized user; and in response to receiving authentication data indicating that a user is an authorized user, cause the opening of the second door to enable release of the payload from the chamber.

10. A method comprising:
determining, by a control system, that an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) is at a pickup location for pickup of a payload, wherein the UAV comprises a fuselage having a first side, a second side, and a chamber arranged to house the payload, wherein a first door is arranged on the first side of the fuselage, wherein an opening of the first door enables loading of the payload into the chamber, wherein a second door is arranged on the second side of the fuselage, and wherein an opening of the second door enables release of the payload from the chamber; in response to determining that the UAV is at the pickup location for pickup of the payload, causing, by the control system, the opening of the first door to enable loading of the payload into the chamber; determining, by the control system, that the UAV is at a delivery location for delivery of the payload; and in response to determining that the UAV is at a delivery location for delivery of the payload, causing, by the control system, the opening of the second door to enable release of the payload from the chamber.

11. The method of claim 10, wherein the second side is a bottom side that is substantially oriented towards the ground during flight of the UAV, and wherein the first side is a top side that is substantially opposite the bottom side.

12. The method of claim 10, wherein the first side is a bottom side that is substantially oriented towards the ground during flight of the UAV, and wherein the second side is a top side that is substantially opposite the bottom side.

13. The method of claim 10, wherein the UAV further comprises an authentication system, the method further comprising:
while the UAV is at the pickup location for pickup of the payload, receiving, by the control system from the authentication system, authentication data indicating that a user is an authorized user, wherein causing the opening of the first door to enable loading of the payload into the chamber is further in response to receiving authentication data indicating that a user is an authorized user.

14. The method of claim 10, wherein the UAV further comprises an authentication system, the method further comprising:
while the UAV is at the delivery location for delivery of the payload, receiving, by the control system from the authentication system, authentication data indicating that a user is an authorized user, wherein causing the opening of the second door to enable release of the payload from the chamber is further in response to receiving authentication data indicating that a user is an authorized user.

15. A method comprising:
receiving, by a control system, a request for a transport task to be performed by at least one unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) from a group of UAVs, wherein the group of UAVs includes at least a first UAV of a first type and a second UAV of a second type, wherein the first type of UAV comprises a fuselage having a first side, a second side, and a chamber arranged to house a payload, wherein a first door is arranged on the first side of the fuselage, wherein an opening of the first door enables loading of the payload into the chamber, wherein a second door is arranged on the second side of the fuselage, and wherein an opening of the second door enables release of the payload from the chamber; based on the first UAV being of the first type, determining, by the control system, that the first UAV meets a criteria for the transport task; and in response to determining that the first UAV meets the criteria for the transport task, causing, by the control system, the first UAV to perform the transport task corresponding to the received request.

16. The method of claim 15, wherein the transport task is associated with a requested item, wherein the first type of UAV is arranged to transport one or more items having a collective weight up to a first weight, wherein the second type of UAV is arranged to transport one or more items having a collective weight up to a second weight, wherein the second weight is greater than the first weight, and wherein determining, based on the first UAV being of the first type, that the first UAV meets the criteria for the transport task comprises:
based on the first UAV being of the first type, determining that the first UAV is arranged to transport the requested item that is of a weight lesser than the first weight.

17. The method of claim 15, wherein the transport task is associated with a requested item, wherein the first type of UAV is arranged to transport one or more items having a collective size up to a first size, wherein the second type of UAV is arranged to transport one or more items having a collective size up to a second seize, wherein the second size is greater than the first size, and wherein determining, based on the first UAV being of the first type, that the first UAV meets the criteria for the transport task comprises:
based on the first UAV being of the first type, determining that the first UAV is arranged to transport the requested item that is of a size lesser than the first size.
18. The method of claim 15, wherein the second type of UAV is arranged to perform tethered delivery of payloads without use of doors to enable loading and release of payloads.

19. A method comprising:
determining, by a control system, that an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) is at a pickup location for pickup of a payload, wherein the UAV comprises a fuselage having a door and a chamber arranged to house the payload; in response to determining that the UAV is at the pickup location for pickup of the payload, causing, by the control system, an opening of the door to enable loading of the payload into the chamber; determining, by the control system, that the UAV is at a delivery location for delivery of the payload; and in response to determining that the UAV is at a delivery location for delivery of the payload, causing, by the control system, an opening of the door to enable release of the payload from the chamber.

20. The method of claim 19, wherein the fuselage has a bottom side that is substantially oriented towards the ground during flight of the UAV, and wherein the door is arranged on a top side that is substantially opposite the bottom side.
21. The method of claim 19, wherein the fuselage has a bottom side that is substantially oriented towards the ground during flight of the UAV, and wherein the door is arranged on the bottom side.

22. The method of claim 19, wherein the fuselage has (i) a bottom side that is substantially oriented towards the ground during flight of the UAV and (ii) a top side that is substantially opposite the bottom side, and wherein the door is arranged on the bottom side, the method further comprising:
while the UAV is at the pickup location for pickup of the payload, causing, by the control system, the UAV to carry out a flip maneuver, wherein the flip maneuver comprising the UAV landing substantially on the top side, wherein causing the opening of the door to enable loading of the payload into the chamber comprises causing the opening of the door to enable loading of the payload into the chamber after completion of the flip maneuver.
